title: Form Setting

description.content: A setting is used to collect one specific piece of information from the  user.
A setting is composed of an identifier on the left and an input element on the right. It may contain a by-line (explanatory text) below the input element.
The effect depends on the control-type of the input element.

context: Settings are used in forms of the settings-tab, in forms of the administration panel and when üputting content into a sub-item.
rules: A setting MUST contained by a Titled Form Section.
A setting MUST use an identifier and an input element.
An identifier MUST be composed of one single term or a very short phrase. The identifier is an eye catcher for users skimming the form.
An identifier MUST avoid lingo. Intelligibility by occasional users is prioritized over technical accuracy. The accurate technical expression is to be mentioned in the by-line.
An identifier MUST make a positive statement. If the purpose of the setting is inherently negative, use Verbs as “Limit..”, “Lock..”.
Wording and structure (sequence and control) MUST be consistent with identifiers in other objects. If you feel a wording needs to be changed, then you MUST propose it to the JF.

A by-line (explanatory text) MAY be added below the input element on the right side. If by-lines are provided they MUST be informative, not merely repeating the identifier’s or input element’s content. If no informative description can be devised, no description is needed.
A by-line MUST clearly state what effect the Setting produces and explain, why this might be important and what it can be used for.
A by-line MUST be placed directly underneath the option it describes. Bulk by-lines underneath a stack of option explaining all of the options in one paragraph MUST NOT be used.
A by-line SHOULD NOT address the user directly. Addressing users directly is reserved for cases of high risk of severe mis-configuration.
A by-line MUST be grammatically complete sentence with a period (.) at the end.
By-lines SHOULD be short with no more than 25 words.
By-lines SHOULD NOT use any formatting in descriptions (bold, italic or similar).

If by-lines refer to other tabs or options or tables by name, that reference should be made in quotation marks:  ‘Info’-tab /  "Info"-Reiter, button ‘Show Test Results’ / Button "Testergebnisse anzeigen",  ‘Table of Detailed Test Results’  /  "Tabelle mit detaillierten Testergebnissen". Use proper quotation marks, not apostrophs. Use single quotation marks for english language and double quotation maks for german language.
By-lines MUST NOT feature parentheses since they greatly diminish readability.

By-lines SHOULD NOT start with terms such as: If this option is set …, If this setting is active …, Choose this setting if … or This setting …. Rather state what happens directly: Participants get / make  / can …, Point in time after which… or ILIAS will monitor ….
